gameCore
Class Tile

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      gameCore.LayoutObject
          gameCore.Tile

public class Tile
extends LayoutObject

A Tile is the minimal unit in the game. They have a location and edges. It can contain items (in the form of an inventory) and a character. A Tile can look at adjacent tiles, but no farther (relative to the public API anyways).

Version:
1.0
Author:
Group D, Main author: Darrell Penner Group D Members --------------- Karen Madore Trang Pham Darrell Penner

canMove

public boolean canMove(Direction direction)
Checks if the character on this tile can move in the given direction. Movement is possible if the edge in between is crossable, and there is no character on the destination tile.

Parameters:
direction - The direction of possible movement.
Returns:
True if movement is possible in the given direction, false otherwise.

getAllDirections

public java.util.Set<Direction> getAllDirections()
Gets all the possible directions for the Tile.

Returns:
The set of all possible directions.

public Character getCharacter()
Gets the character on this tile.

Returns:
The character if one exists, null otherwise

getCharacter

public Character getCharacter(Direction direction)
Gets the character on the adjacent tile in the given direction.

Parameters:
direction - The direction to search for
Returns:
the Character on the adjacent tile, null if none exists
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the character on this tile cannot cross the edge in the given direction

Parameters:
direction - The direction to look in.
Returns:
The inventory on the adjacent tile
Throws:

Parameters:

Returns:
True if the edge is crossable, false otherwise

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty()
Checks if the tile is empty. A tile is considered empty if it has no Items an on Character

Returns:
True if the tile is empty, false otherwise

isEmpty

public boolean isEmpty(Direction direction)
Checks if the adjacent tile is empty. A tile is considered empty if it has no Items and no Character

Parameters:
direction - The direction in which to check
Returns:
True if the adjacent tile is empty, false otherwise

isVisited

Moves the character to the tile in the given direction.

Parameters:
direction - The direction to move the player
Returns:
The new tile of the character
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the player cannot move in the given direction. Try calling canMove(direction) first.
